metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2201 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in WordPress before 3.5.2 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors involving (1) uploads of media files, (2) editing of media files, (3) installation of plugins, (4) updates to plugins, (5) installation of themes, or (6) updates to themes.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2201` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwelve - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.5.2+dfsg-1').
